channel.description: Recent content in Secure on DevDocs Navigation Menu Test

item.title: Secure your tokens
item.description: Secure your tokens Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Structure type: Navigation Content type: Dynamic Index A dynamic index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs. For example: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/authorization/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/api-security/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/manage-users/

item.title: Rotate your apps client secrets
item.description: Rotate your app’s client secrets Click here to give feedback about this page Group Notes Group description: - No specific user research obtained for client secrets Client secrets are used in Authentication hence the reason why they are in Authenticate Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Links to original docs: - Client secret rotation and key management: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/client-secret-rotation-key/main/ Structure type: Task Content type: How-to A How-to document illustrates how to perform a specific task that does not rely on writing code.

item.title: Secure your Okta API authentication with JWTs
item.description: Secure your Okta API authentication with JWTs Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Links to original docs: - Build a JWT for Client Authentication: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/build-self-signed-jwt/java/main/ Structure type: Task Content type: Integration guide An integration guide or coding guide illustrates how to perform a specific task that involves writing code. It is similar to a how-to but the focus is more technical and geared towards developers integrating an SDK, API, or another library into their applications.

item.title: Add a third-party risk provider
item.description: Add a third-party risk provider Click here to give feedback about this page Content Notes Target personas: WIC App Developer,Experienced IAM developer Description: This document shows how to configure a third party provider using the API and create a simple event log. I think we could make this use case more robust and describe a better more detailed use case. This risk engine described in this doc can be useful in both secure and system log.
